pull_request.title: Apply Force/Torque dialog: Activate window when visual clicked

pullrequest.title: Apply Force/Torque dialog: Activate window when visual clicked

content.raw: While preparing the next pull request I realized why this hadn't been done before. If you activate the dialog when selecting the model, it becomes very hard to enter translate/rotate modes and manipulate the object. I'll remove this in the next pr if you don't mind. Let me know if you have another idea.
content.html: While preparing the next pull request I realized why this hadn't been done before. If you activate the dialog when selecting the model, it becomes very hard to enter translate/rotate modes and manipulate the object. I'll remove this in the next pr if you don't mind. Let me know if you have another idea.

pull_request.title: Apply Force/Torque dialog: Activate window when visual clicked

update.description:
This pull requests introduces a lot of code for very little functionality: activating the dialog corresponding to the clicked visual. 

To test it, you'll need to have at least 2 `ApplyWrenchDialog`s open at the same time (for different links or the same link) and clicking on the orange visuals should focus its corresponding dialog.

Background: pull request #1506 was declined because it introduced mysterious crashes, so I've been dividing it into smaller PRs. So far, pull request #1600 and pull request #1619 have been merged.

Jenkins: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/148/console

content.raw: We want the event to be propagated to GL widget, so models can still be selected in the scene.
content.html: We want the event to be propagated to GL widget, so models can still be selected in the scene.

content.raw: That's a good point. I think I hadn't done this before because once we have the pink circles, when we click on the model, we don't know if we should attach the circles to force or torque. But I guess we could default to force... I'll do that.
content.html: That's a good point. I think I hadn't done this before because once we have the pink circles, when we click on the model, we don't know if we should attach the circles to force or torque. But I guess we could default to force... I'll do that.

content.raw: That's happening because the dialog is not being closed when the model is deleted. This should be fixed by pull request #1614

content.raw: One thing I noticed is that when I close Gazebo with one or more Force/Torque Dialogs open, the dialog boxes will stick around and I have to manually close them before the gzclient process dies. But that can be addressed in a future pull request.
content.html: One thing I noticed is that when I close Gazebo with one or more Force/Torque Dialogs open, the dialog boxes will stick around and I have to manually close them before the gzclient process dies. But that can be addressed in a future pull request.

FAIL!  : ApplyWrenchDialog_TEST::MouseInteractions() '!applyWrenchDialogBox->isActiveWindow()' returned FALSE. ()

content.raw:
By the way, due to issue #1261, the tests will fail if all are run at the same time. So to run only the new test:

~~~
./build/gazebo/gui/UNIT_ApplyWrenchDialog_TEST MouseInteractions
~~~
content.html:
By the way, due to issue #1261, the tests will fail if all are run at the same time. So to run only the new test:

./build/gazebo/gui/UNIT_ApplyWrenchDialog_TEST MouseInteractions
